column2: Create JSCA reader
column3: Once the JSCA schema schema has been defined, we need to create code to can read schemas following that format. The reader will require the schema schema to be modified to support event handlers as types, properties, etc. are consumed by the reader.

column2: Store Analytic ping events in database
column3: We want to store the events in a database in case the user is offline.

column2: Context info popup blocks code when using mutli-line function invocations
column3: This is showing up particularly when using object literals inside method invocations. It looks like the popup itself needs to follow the row of the current offset; whereas, right now it basically places itself one line below the function invocation start

column2: Prompt for perspective reset if perspective layout/information has changed
column3: We can pull this code from Studio 2. Allow us to version the perspective, and if we up the perspective version, prompt the user if they would like to reset the perspective to a new version.

column2: Close Studio or force update if user attempts to use product past pre-set expiration date
column3: Hardcode in date of June 1, 2011. If the user reaches that date and attempts to use the product, force them to update to a new version, or shut the product down (standalone), or disabled the plugin (if used inside Eclipse)

column2: Refactor all ping related methods to a utility class
column3: For example in newmobileprojectwizard.java. we can extract sendCreateProjectEvent to a utility class

column2: Add preferences for Titanium Desktop and Mobile SDKs
column3: We currently don't have a way for users to adjust where their titanium desktop and mobile sdks are installed.  We will want to initialize them to   Mac: /Library/Application Support/Titanium/  Linux: ~/.titanium/  Win32: %ProgramData%\\Titanium\\

column2: Download latest SDK on initial Titanium Startup
column3: If a user starts Titanium Studio, and does not have a SDK installed, we need to ensure they have one ready. This might be done already--if so, great. Otherwise, let's automatically download and install the latest desktop and mobile SDKs.

column2: Clean doesn't actually clean a mobile project
column3: We need to make "Clean" actually remove the contents of both the build/iphone and build/android directories (but not the directory itself).  This will cause a real clean when you build the project and regenerate compiled files.

column2: Upgrade packaged JRuby to 1.6.0 RC3
column3: They've just released JRuby 1.6.0 RC3, which fixes a bug we saw with some users on Windows with funky default charsets. we should upgrade when possible.

column2: Allow users to download older versions of Mobile SDK
column3: Change "Install Titanium SDK From URL..." to "Install Specific Titanium SDK..."    Add radio button:  * Install from URL: Top text box will stay as before, allowing people to paste in. Add browse button to surf to local location on disk  * Install from Up

column2: Exclude build folder from AppExplorer
column3: When an application is building, you could see constant workspace updating in Progress view.

column2: Keep user signed in for 24 hours since last sign in if offline
column3: Basically, if user goes offline, he currently still could continue to use TiStudio features, but until Studio restart. It would be better to have some grace period if offline.

column2: Splash/Login Screen looks empty if user is already logged in
column3: Screenshot attached. it may be that the page should just be condensed somewhat, since I don't think we need that much space for the username/password fields. Otherwise, can we place something in the blank area that would look fine if the fields are pasted

column3: The code for dealing with modules was commented out by me in porting over the Ti Dev 1 packager for Desktop, since we didn't have this in our metadata or anything. We need to re-implement this now that we are keeping track of this.

column2: Enter/Return doesn't being Login on login splash screen
column3: When you first start TI Studio, it brings up a login screen. I entered my credentials, hit Return and... nothing. It should invoke the login button.

column3: The username label is mis-leading. I believe we're always looking for the user's email address they used to register with.

column2: JS Content assist is only looking up members of Window for global namespace
column3: When we lookup globals for Content Assist we explicitly look for members of Window. This is wrong, because we also need to look up members of it's supertype Global.

column2: JS Content Assist doesn't contain ECMAScript 5 types/properties
column3: There are no entries for things like JSON.parse, JSON.stringify, Date.now, etc in our metadata.    We need to add metadata for the new items added in ECMAScript 5. See http://kangax.github.com/es5-compat-table/ and http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-2

column2: Window type is used as global namespace for all JS files
column3: We explicitly make use of "Window" as the assumed global namespace for all JS files. This is only correct if the file is intended to be run inside a browser.    With the use of TiMobile JS and Node.JS, in that environment, "Global" is the type we should b

column2: Hook up a special Content Assist processor for Alloy view XML files
column3: We need to provide Content Assist specific to Alloy view XML files. They use a standard *.xml file extension. We'll need to add an Alloy XML Editor and hook up a specialized content assist processor so that for *.xml files in an alloy project (under the a

column2: Create a TSS lexer
column3: We need to generate a TSS lexer to feed the parser. See the PEGJS grammar here: https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/blob/master/Alloy/grammar/tss.pegjs    We'll need to extract a JFlex TSS.lex file from the rules there.

column2: Create a TSS parser
column3: We need to generate a TSS Parser. See the PEGJS grammar here: https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/blob/master/Alloy/grammar/tss.pegjs    We'll need to generate an LALR grammar from that and then use beaver to generate a parser. We may be able to simply

column2: Create a TSS editor
column3: Once we have a TSS grammar and lexer, we need to create a TSS editor and associate it with *.tss files. We should remove the old association between JSON and *.tss.

column2: Colorize TSS files
column3: Once we have a TSS editor, we'll need to hook up coloring. This involves setting up partitions, a partition scanner, and token scanners for the partitions. We can look to {{JSONSourceConfiguration}} as the example to copy and slightly modify. We can likel

column2: Validate TSS file syntax
column3: Once we have a proper parser we can use it to highlight syntax errors. This will involve creating a build participant that simply grabs the context's AST, asks for the SyntaxErrors and hooks them as problems to the BuildContext. See {{JSParserValidator}}

column2: Platform configuration wizard: Provide progress on the download/install when the platforms are being configured

column2: Remove the "Configure SDKs" link

column2: Remove the "Configure SDKs" link
column3: We find the link to be an extreme edge case most users won't need now that we're providing installation of unconfigured platforms inside the wizard.

column2: Platform Config Wizard: update the description once we are in the progress page

column2: Platform Config Wizard: Progress page: use the stop icon for cancel
column3: The current cancel icon looks disabled. The suggestion is to use the stop icon seen in Console and Debug views.

column2: By default do not show text for the list of open perspectives in global toolbar

column2: Enable global toolbar for the simple Studio perspective
column3: Once we clean up the global toolbar and add the new UI for device profile, we should re-enable global toolbar for the simple perspective.

column3: A suggestion is to only have the dark theme applied to editor. There is currently a preference to apply theme to all views, so maybe set it to false by default?

column2: Enforce builds fail if code coverage drops
column3: Currently we only record code coverage on nightly builds for display/info purposes. We should set minimum thresholds which fail the test build (and therefore end up disallowing pushes/syncs to QE/Beta/RC) if we don't meet the value. We should also enforce

column2: Make AirWatch plugins installable only onto Appcelerator Studio
column3: AirWatch integration will be eventually rolled into Appcelerator Studio 3.3.0. In the mean time, it should be installable only to Appcelerator Studio, not Titanium Studio.

column2: Enforce code coverage doesn't drop for normal development builds
column3: Once we have code coverage recorded for the three normal builds that run unit tests, we should enforce the coverage never drops like we do for nightlies. This way we can catch if a commit will break the build because of this earlier in the process.

column2: Switch to using Findbugs rank over priority

column2: User can configure dependency blocking
column3: Applicable per child plan  User can configure whether dependency children are blocked from building when ancestors are running.

column2: Check ancestors of a build when it is triggered and prevent building if changes found (in ancestors) Ancestors are kicked off
column3: E.g.  B triggered, whilst A is not building. Check A, if changes found in A, build A, don't build B.    What if A is a manual and dependent builds only? or a schedule build?    Ignore the trigger for now. Later optimizations needed.

column2: Detect infinte cycles in dependent builds.

column2: If AJS.conglomerate.cookie gets too big, web servers will report HTTP error 413

column2: Rename StatementInfo to ExpressionInfo
column3: Rename StatementInfo to ExpressionInfo in the API. Java is the odd one out here. Scala, Clojure etc all have expressions as there basic unit of execution. A statement is an expression with no result.

column2: Unicode 0x200B (zero-width whitespace) causes instrumentation failure
column3: JDK 6 implements Unicode 4.0. In this version of Unicode, the zero-width whitespace character (0x200B) is being treated as a whitespace.    JDK 7 implements Unicode 6.0. In this version of Unicode, the zero-width whitespace has been reclassified to the 'f

column3: Many meas_base Plugins and Algorithms have poor documentation, including several whose documentation is a copy/paste relic from some other algorithm.  These need to be fixed.

column2: add base class for measurement tasks
column3: We should consider adding a base class for measurement tasks (SingleFrameMeasurementTask, ForcedMeasuremedTask) that includes the callMeasure methods.  I'm hoping this will help cleanup callMeasure and improve code reuse.

column2: Add FunctorKey to replace Coord compound keys
column3: Unlike previous FunctorKey replacements, Coord compound Keys are used in the minimal schema for SimpleTable and SourceTable, which makes removing them problematic.

column2: allow partial measurement results to be set when error flag is set
column3: We need to be able to return values at the same time that an error flag is set.  The easiest way to do this is to have Algorithms take a Result object as an output argument rather than return it.  We'll revisit this design later.

CModel robustness

column2: test number/order of shapelet expansions needed to approximate PSF

column2: Simultaneous astrometry requirements
column3: The HSC group needs improvements to the simultaneous astrometry fitter delivered by Astier et al.  In particular we'll need to do simultaneous photometry as well.  This epic is to determine the superset requirements for such a system.

column2: Refactor Jointcal to use stack functionality
column3: Jointcal currently has a lot of built-in features that already exist elsewhere in the stack (e.g. GTransfo, StarSelector, Points, etc.). These features should be removed and replaced with the equivalent stack functionality.

column2: Implement simultaneous photometry
column3: The simultaneous astrometry framework should be able to be extended to also fit the photometry at the same time.  This task is to do just that.  The task to create a pluggable framework should help with this.

column2: Clean up Wcs classes
column3: The Wcs classes as they currently exist are not easy to extend and also contains overrides that are a bit ad hoc.  This task is to clean up the existing classes so that there is a single abstract base class.  It should also be a priority of this task to d

column2: Gather requirements for improved Wcs classes
column3: The new Wcs class should be able to apply transforms in a stack so that many different distortions as different scales can be corrected for separately (rather than trying to correct the whole mess with a single 2D polynomial).  There is some work going on

column2: Produce a design for the new Wcs classes
column3: This will require generating a design as well as getting it reviewed via RFC.  The hope is that other work can be ongoing while the RFC process is carried out.

column2: Implement new Wcs classes
column3: Once a design is accepted implement the new design. This epic covers the replacement of afw:image:wcs with afw:transform/afw:mapping (names currently in flux), but does not involve changes to XYTransform.

column2: Make Wcs persistable
column3: Regardless of the mechanism used by the new Wcs classes, they will need to be persistable.  This will probably require some significant work unless classes that are already persistable are used in the design.

column2: Identify all corrections ISR needs to handle
column3: This is informed by DECAM etc.  This is just for the corrections that do not require detection.  For example, we will push out CR rejection until the question of snaps is decided.

column2: Implement all ISR corrections for LSST
column3: Most corrections have some implementation.  Perhaps the most difficult will be crosstalk since the implementation should allow for correction over multiple chips.

column2: Make up a test for dipole measurement
column3: To facilitate work on the dipole measurement, a test will be helpful.  This could simply be an image with dipoles made with Gaussian PSFs with Poisson noise on top.  The important thing is to be able to determine whether the algorithm is returning the rig

column2: Improve the dipole measurement task
column3: The current dipole measurement algorithm has some issues.  It also doesn't work in the current measurement framework.  This task is to improve the dipole measurement.  The result of this epic should be improved results when run on the test data.

column2: Replace the heap in ScanScheduler with a list.
